answers.answer: Hi,How are you feeling?Your symptomatology suggests that you are having signs of neuropathy. Pain, tingling and numbness are signs of neuropathy.Nerve involvement may be single (mono-neuropathy) or multiple (poly-neuropathy).This neuropathy can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae.In your case the symptoms are due to nerve compression at the level of shoulder joint as you are having numbness till your hand.Your symptoms could be due to shoulder impingement.You should be consulting a neurologist and an orthopaedician for your further reference.Keep me posted.Bye.

question: I started off with pains in my elbow for a few days then it moved to my shoulder where it progressed to get worse... Now when i go to wash my hair or put my arm above my head for a few mins my arm goes numb all the way to my hand... Any ideas on what could be causing this or what i can do about it... I have tried taking advil and it does not seem to be helping.... even just typing this makes my hand tingle
title: numbness
